TopicTitle: Space Shuttle Pack for ksp 1.0.4 dev thread

Articles.Content:
oms specific impulse corrected, thrust correct. adjusting burn time now.

cargobay adapter nodes corrected.

canadarm2 100% complete

all iss truss sections docking redone and checking now

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T08:03:58Z" title="08/02/2015 08:03  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by Mike-NZ**
quite a few issues and things fixed on tonight's iss update if anyone is after it .
i cant make canadaarm2 works in EVA but in hangar it works normal(( what i have to do?

> 
> i cant make canadaarm2 works in EVA but in hangar it works normal(( what i have to do?

I think I know what it could be. I will have a look into it tonight thanks

Can someone post a tutorial on how to land the shuttle? I have FAR installed on my build, and I tried a calm angle de-orbit from 100km but as I entered the atmosphere it was as if there was no drag AT ALL. I came screaming in unaffected at 2km/s at an altitude of 18km as i passed over the KSC and right about at maybe 8km or so everything starts to flip out and i lose control and smash into the ocean going ~2km/s

Edit: to clarify on no-drag, I would be at 20km altitude and still ACCELERATING from gravity rather than slowing down from the atmosphere, my g-meter read 0 and I was engulfed in reentry flames

> 
> Can someone post a tutorial on how to land the shuttle? I have FAR installed on my build, and I tried a calm angle de-orbit from 100km but as I entered the atmosphere it was as if there was no drag AT ALL. I came screaming in unaffected at 2km/s at an altitude of 18km as i passed over the KSC and right about at maybe 8km or so everything starts to flip out and i lose control and smash into the ocean going ~2km/s

Far has not yet been worked out for the shuttle sorry. I will try put it in soon

> 
> Far has not yet been worked out for the shuttle sorry. I will try put it in soon

Oh okay no problem, I didn't know there was a problem with it as I assumed the new KSP aero-update had basically become FAR without all of the information and simulation data the mod provides.

> 
> Can someone post a tutorial on how to land the shuttle? I have FAR installed on my build, and I tried a calm angle de-orbit from 100km but as I entered the atmosphere it was as if there was no drag AT ALL. I came screaming in unaffected at 2km/s at an altitude of 18km as i passed over the KSC and right about at maybe 8km or so everything starts to flip out and i lose control and smash into the ocean going ~2km/s
> Edit: to clarify on no-drag, I would be at 20km altitude and still ACCELERATING from gravity rather than slowing down from the atmosphere, my g-meter read 0 and I was engulfed in reentry flames

Also, for future references, aim beyond the space center because you can always perform s-curves to slow down and descend.

> 
> Also, for future references, aim beyond the space center because you can always perform s-curves to slow down and descend.
